answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Since you have been getting symptoms on and off it will be good if you can get your blood sugar tested. Repeated rash and boils are seen in diabetes. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
Thanks for the reply.  i had my blood sugar test done  and the doctor said i have low sugar level ..and said i dont have diabetes.   still can not figure out what  the problem is..

question: Sir/MadamI need help regarding my symptoms that are comming angoing for last 10 months ..their was  ringworm spots on both of my inner thigh i went to my family physician and he gave me some cream .i applied that cream and the sppts were light thereafter i noticed within 3-4 days i had a red rash on my left shoulder  than i went to my  doctor again and he gave me antibotic course for 10 day .. i completed my course after 2 days the rash was gone ..then again the rash appeard on my right side ..after few days i noticed a bump on my left virgina initially it was painfull than the pain went  away i went to another doctor he gave me another course of antibotics  i took all the medicine and boil was gone after few days before getting my mensturl cycle another side that right side it appeared and continued for 8 months i went to several doctors they did blood test it was ok they said that bump is small so no culter can be done.... now the rash is shifted in both of my legs it is just like pimples and itiching doctor refered me to internal medicine they did blood test nothing come the other doctor refered me to infectious disease speacilist they said that it is not perasitic infection .so i dont know what to do before my periods starts the small pimle like bump appears on my legs both of them and red rash on my shoulder,,,,need advicethanks and regard
